name: 2 Bedroom Family Cottage - Sleeps up to 6
description:
Relax as a couple, or the whole family, at our peaceful cottage. Historic Lyndoch is the ideal place from which to experience the famous Barossa Valley. The cottage is just a short 800 metres from shops, bakery, and more. Restaurants and vineyards are within minutes. We supply 3 free bicycles to explore the Barossa Cycling trails (Pre booking required). Another 2 bedroom cottage is available on the same site. Search airbnb for " 2 bedrooms with Woodfire, Barossa Country Cottages " .

The space
Each cottage has 2 full bedrooms, a full kitchen, 3 way bathroom, and separate lounge/dining area. Free Wi-fi is available. There is a balcony with outdoor chairs at the front of each cottage, and a communal barbeque area as well. There is even a washing machine in each cottage. There is also a children's playgym.
This cottage has one bedroom with a queen bed, and the second bedroom has two single beds. There is also a double sofa bed in the lounge room.
We also
host_about: Hi, We love hosting people at our cottages in the Barossa, both at the 1890s historic Barossa Hills Cottages in Springton, and these two bedroom family cottages at Lyndoch. In February 2022 the previous owners retired, and we have now refreshed the cottages - which are renowned throughout the Barossa as affordable family (& pet!) friendly accommodation.

The Coachman's Cottage is a lovingly renovated single storey building sitting within its own garden with covered patio, seating and BBQ.
It offers 2 King bedrooms, each with its own ensuite.
You will find a wonderfully cosy sitting room and dining area as well as a fully set up kitchen (Incl. dishwasher, espresso machine).

name: Sierra Madre - Idyllic stay in the heart of town.
description:
Its all about the location.... Immerse yourself into the heart of the iconic Barossa Valley and stay at the Idyllic, Character filled bungalow - Sierra Madre.
A Beautiful, quaint and very charming property conveniently situated only meters from the ever so popular Tanunda main street. Take your pick of coffee shops, cafes, restaurants, cellar doors, shopping, and more.
Or... Choose to stay in, unwind, relax and surround yourself in a beautiful and well appointed little piece of paradise.

The space
Sierra Madre is full of character, beautifully presented and feels like home.
It offers you 3 spacious bedrooms sleeping up to 6 people, Main Bedroom with a smart T.V. Open plan living, dining and kitchen with dishwasher, stove, oven, microwave, full size fridge, coffee machine, and Bose speaker. The open plan area also includes a wood burning fire for those cooler nights. There is also a second living area, delightful newly renovated bathroom, full lau
neighborhood_overview:
You wont find a much better location than this!
Sierra Madre is a short 2 minute walk to the hub of Tanunda.
You are walking distance to everything you need, Information Center, Supermarket, Bakery, Restaurant's, Bars, Cafes, Bottle shop, Retail Shopping, Playground / Oval and more.

The Barossa is made up of some beautiful little towns only a short drive away, and they all offer something different. So we encourage you to take a drive around and find some of our unique spots, You wont be disappointed.
There is always plenty to do and something for everyone.

Explore the many cellar doors and wineries, enjoy a relaxing long lunch at one of the many restaurants, take a stroll through the conservation park, visit the bustling farmers market, stroll the streets, or perhaps book yourself in for an unforgettable experience somewhere. So much to see and do.

name: McGill Vineyard Barossa
description:
Holiday in the middle of a vineyard with stunning sunset views over the vines. Well located to many famous wineries and two of the main towns in Barossa, a short 4 mins drive into Angaston, 7 mins to Nurioopta and 11 mins and Tanunda, you could not get a more convenient location while enjoying the vineyard lifestyle. Walk to the Vintners markets at the bottom of the street on a Saturday morning for fresh local produces.
Some the closest wineries are Yalumba, Penfolds, Artisans, Tomfoolery, Gibson and Saltram.
host_about:
Tita brings a new generation of experience to property services, she is across holiday rental. 

Coming from a background of 5 years of property management experience, she is already the owner of her first property and she is the director of a cleaning and maintenance business. 

Having the specialist Airbnb cleaning business experience Tita knows the standards that guests and owners expect to ensure a 5 star experience.

Being a home owner herself Tita understands how important your home is to you and how much it needs to be cared for and will treat it like her own.

Living on the Sunshine Coast is the best!

It is within comfortable walking distance to all of Angaston's attractions including; Yalumba Winery, The South Australian Company Store & The Angaston Main Street.
The Angaston Main Street offers a little something for everyone with beautiful cafes, bakeries, wine bars, restaurants & hotels.
The Blacksmiths Shop, History Centre, the Barossa Bike Track and the newly constructed Barossa Adventure Station are all fantastic attractions.

The space
51 Gramp Ave is a comfortable, self contained 3 bedroom (2x queen and 1x single), 1 bathroom, 1 laundry, 1 work space home. The lounge room has leather recliners, an imitation wood fireplace, air conditioning and a smart TV (with netfix). The fully equipped kitchen is fitted with everything you need including modern appliances, a coffee pod machine, cutlery, crockery and cooking equipment. The bedrooms are dressed with 5 star linen, all have mirror

Rest and relax on the verandah or on the luscious laws of this 3 bedroom recently renovated fully fenced bungalow. Latest digital TV, WIFI, dedicated study room. This property has so much to offer.

The space
Poppy’s Place is filled with modern amenities that make for the perfect escape to the Barossa Valley.
A magnificent look out from the front verandah for your morning coffee, ideally set amongst the oldest houses in Angaston shaded by large mature trees. Sturt street is an easy walking distance to the main street coffee shops, wine tasting rooms, popular restaurants, and more.

Two bedrooms with queen size beds - all linen supplied.

description:
Our cottage has all you need for your Barossa stay. It’s walking distance to shops, restaurants, cafes & the iconic Barossa Farmers Market.

A cottage feel as you arrive, with a clean white crisp interior, this is a well renovated, comfortable stone cottage, perfect for two couples.

Comprising two queen bedrooms, a sitting room w gas fire, separate dining area, well-appointed kitchen with coffee pod machine, 1.5 bathrooms, second separate toilet & outdoor seating area. Minimum 2 night stay.

The space
This is a cosy country cottage in the heart of the Barossa makes this an ideal location for short of long stays.

We encourage our guests to enter the cottage from the back door via the large pergola where the entrance opens into a fully functioning kitchen with oven, dishwasher, fridge, coffee pod machine and all the cooking equipment you might need.
The kitchen opens into a small dining area with a pot belly log fire. The bathr
neighborhood_overview: Angaston is a little Barossa town set into the hillside on the way to Eden Valley. The township provides for everything you need including a butcher, baker, cafes, multiple wine bars, supermarket and many close wineries. With close proximity to Tanunda, Nuriootpa and the rest of the Barossa & Eden Valleys, Angaston is the perfect location for your stay.

Mattner House provides the ideal escape from everyday life. Magnificent views surrounded with sunset reflections across the Barossa Ranges simply stunning.

The space
Enjoy 6 bedrooms plus the wonderful extra feature of a children's play room. 3 bedrooms with Queen size bed and ensuite bathroom. Another 3 bedrooms have 2 single beds in each room. An ideal location to base you and up to 14 friends in the Barossa Valley.We also offer a bottle of wine on arrival and have a Nespresso coffee machine available as well as tea and milk.

name: Deluxe Queen Room
description:
Relax with the whole family at this peaceful place to stay.

The space
Our ultra-stylish Deluxe Twin rooms offer superb comfort and furnished with one Queen and one Single Bed. With microfibre quilts, extra fluffy pillows and crisp white linen, they comfortably sleep 2 adults.
host_about:
The Wine Vine Hotel offers affordable accommodations in the heart of the Barossa wine region, less than 1.2 mi from the Barossa Wine and Visitor Center.

All rooms at the The Wine Vine Hotel include air conditioning, electric blankets, and a private outdoor veranda.

You can enjoy a game of tennis on the court, and in the summer season between October and April you can enjoy a swim in the pool.

The The Wine Vine Hotel gives you easy access to over 80 wineries. Famous local attractions are Mengler Hill Scenic Look-out, Conservation Park Bush, and the Whispering Wall.

The Barossa Cheese Company, Lyndoch Lavender Farm, Concordia Fruit Wines, and Maggie Beer's Farm Shop are all a short drive from the motel.

Couples in particular like the location – they rated it 8.5 for a two-person trip.

The Wine Vine Hotel has been welcoming (Website hidden by Airbnb) guests since Apr 19, 2010

You can enjoy a game of tennis on the court, and in the summer season between October and April you can enjoy a swim in the pool.

The The Wine Vine Hotel gives you easy access to over 80 wineries. Famous local attractions are Mengler Hill Scenic Look-out, Conservation Park Bush, and the Whispering Wall.

The Barossa Cheese Company, Lyndoch Lavender Farm, Concordia Fruit Wines, and Maggie Beer's Farm Shop are all a short drive from the motel.

Couples in particular like the location – they rated it 8.5 for a two-person trip.

The Wine Vine Hotel has been welcoming (Website hidden by Airbnb) guests since Apr 19, 2010

name: Charming cottage in Angaston
description:
The Rusty Olive is an intimate lovers retreat nestled in the heart of Angaston, one of the most beautiful towns in the Barossa Valley wine region.

Come and relax under the rustic pergola area and prepare yourself a tasty gourmet breakfast with local produce supplied.

The cottage is located in a quiet street, a 5-min walk to cafes, wine bar, gourmet cheese shop, local bakery, butcher & much more. Only a 15-min drive to the wine region, it's ideal for a romantic getaway.

The space
The early settlers cottage has been lovingly restored to retain the charm of a bygone era but with modern-day comforts. It offers a functional kitchen with a dishwasher and coffee machine. Provisions are supplied for breakfast, made from the best local produce, on the first morning of your stay.

Absorb the ambient beauty of the bathroom where you can relax in a cast iron, claw foot bath or a spacious shower, alone or together.

In the bedroom yo
neighborhood_overview:
Angaston, South Australia, Australia . Angaston is the prettiest town in the Barossa with a rich history and beautiful gardens. it has a wonderful German butcher, bakery and gourmet cheese shop plus restaurants and cafes all within walking distance of The Rusty Olive.

At sunset, unwind with a glass of Barossa wine on the front verandah overlooking the old stone faced St Hugh's Anglician Church, opened in 1931.
host_about:
A short history of ownership... The Rusty Olive was built in 1900 and was bought in an unrestored state by Sue and Michael Falkenberg in 2008. Sue and Michael then spent some 8 years restoring it to the magnificent building you see today. The original stonework was preserved, and the interior completely rebuilt with a sympathetic mix of modern and existing features. 

The home was designed as a luxury retreat and has been operating as an Airbnb since 2018. In April 2022, Sue and Michael sold the property to the current owners, Adam and Marilyn Laws. They fell in love with the Rusty Olive after staying for two weeks early in 2022. Marilyn grew up in the Barossa Valley and most of her family still reside here. Now based in Sydney, they regularly return “home” to experience the great lifestyle and family experiences in the Barossa. 

We hope you enjoy your stay in The Rusty Olive.

name: Cosy Barossa Getaway - Beautiful, 3BR Retreat
description:
With a traditional view of the vineyards and hills as the picture-perfect backdrop straight from your back door, this immaculate three-bedroom solid brick masterpiece at Tanunda's doorstep is a must-see for any traveller looking for a comfortable and convenient base. Inside, a blend of old and new creates a fresh, modern vibe that stays faithful to an original country aesthetic. The house sits on a large lot, and its surrounding garden provides a number of peaceful retreats.

The space
Upon entry, you are greeted by polished timber floors that flow throughout the bedrooms, hallways and lounge.

The three generously sized bedrooms are ideal for a family, individuals or couples, and bedroom three has an added bonus: a floor-to-ceiling mirrored built-in robe. 2 bedrooms boast ceiling fans and all are complemented with large windows.

The formal and informal dining area plus sunroom and kitchen have a spectacular rough sandstone floor tile that add
neighborhood_overview: The red heart of the Barossa, Tanunda sits in prime position surrounded by the region’s best wineries. Deriving its name from the Aboriginal word for watering hole, you’ll certainly find more than a few good spots to quench your thirst around this historic town. Sample wine straight from the barrel at Chateau Tanunda, go back to (wine) school at Greenock Estates or sip bold reds in a heritage stone barn at Rockford Wines. Wander down leafy streets dotted with heritage buildings, stop for lunch at Vino Lokal, indulge your sweet tooth at Barossa Valley Chocolate Company, dig into dinner at fermentASIAN and top it off with a night cap at Musque Food & Wine. Down the road, discover Seppeltsfield; home to Seppeltsfield Winery, Hentley Farm Restaurant and Seppeltsfield Road Distillers
host_about:
Gingerbread Haus is a team of fun loving travel enthusiasts. (With more than 80 countries under our belt) 

Running various businesses including a cleaning company, we provide full-service management and know that customer service is key. 

Adelaide grown, our team are based around the city and have excellent knowledge of the best gyms, restaurants and cafes. 

Gingerbread handles all guest enquiries, check-ins, maintenance requests and guest communication during all reservations.

We are here to help you so don’t hesitate to contact us. 

We hope you enjoy your stay

name: Chateau Yaldara House
description:
The Yaldara House is a luxurious 5 bedroom accommodation venue situated at Chateau Yaldara on the banks of the Lyndoch Creek. Originally built by the founder of Chateau Yaldara, Hermann Thumm, it has been lovingly restored to now provide you with an ideal location to base your Barossa Valley Holiday or simply hide away in the Yaldara house and enjoy wine and an escape from everyday life.

The space
5 Deluxe bedrooms with ensuite bathroom, all Queen size bed. An ideal location to base you and up to 10 friends in the Barossa Valley.

Other things to note
We also offer a bottle of wine on arrival and have a Nespresso coffee machine available as well as tea and milk.
neighborhood_overview: Chateau Yaldara. Hermann Thumm founded Chateau Yaldara in 1947 after he migrated to Australia from Europe. The chateau was named ‘Yaldara’ after the local Aboriginal word meaning ‘sparkling’. The site chosen for the winery was on the banks of the North Para River at a flax mill dating back to 1867.

description:

The front verandah and paved courtyard at rear offer tranquil outdoor dining spaces. Continental breakfast is included; fresh milk and yogurt, cereals, fresh juice and sourdough.

Nestled in the heart of the Barossa wine region, it’s only a 10 minute drive to discover Penfolds, Yalumba, Two Hands, Langmeil & Henschke wineries, Maggie Beer’s Farm Shop & Restaurant, and more.

Angaston Township is a 4 minute walk away, including The Barossa Valley Cheese Co, wine bars, and plentiful restaurants and cafes. The Barossa Farmer’s Market, held every Saturday, is only 3 minutes down the road. Located a 3 minute walk away, multiple buses provide easy access to some of the b
neighborhood_overview:
The Barossa is an internationally-acclaimed wine region encompassing the towns of Tanunda, Angaston and Nuriootpa, boasting more than 150 wineries and 80 cellar doors.

Just a 50 minute drive north east of Adelaide, When you’re not sipping the region’s top drops you can admire the vines from a hot air balloon, dine at renowned restaurants and explore nearby villages and national parks.

name: Horse Side Tiny House
description:
Experience the unhurried backcountry retreat at Horse Side Tiny House, South Australia. The perfect farm stay nestled in wide-open spaces, native birdlife, and farm animals (e.g., such as horses, sheep, and alpacas) to keep you company. An amazing piece of paradise, where you can take deep calming breaths and lazy afternoon naps in Kapunda. 

IMPORTANT NOTE: Please note that the tiny house is only a short distance from the main street, so you may hear passing vehicles on the property.

The space
Horse Side Tiny House is located near Barossa Valley of South Australia, where you can rest and enjoy comfortable accommodation with easy access to water, split air conditioning, a kitchenette, cooking equipment, and excellent bathroom facilities.

The bathroom, however, follows ecologically sustainable principles, including a waterless eco-friendly compost toilet, hand basin, and shower (gas heated for hot showers). It focuses on satisfying people's ne
neighborhood_overview:
Horse Side Tiny House sits in a small town near Barossa Valley in South Australia. Where you can explore restaurants, shops, and attractions for you to enjoy. So, make an endless list of things to do.

Our local recommendations:

- Pizza Bar and Takeaway serves a diverse selection of ingredients for dine-in and takeaway pizzas in town.
- One White Kite is a cafe that offers a delicious selection of pastries, light meals, coffee, and tea in Kapunda.
- Kapunda Mine Trail is a popular attraction that marks the first commercially copper metal mine in Australia.
- Kapunda Tourist Park is a camping and cabin accommodation set in a well-shaded park in Dutton Park, Kapunda.
- Whispering Wall is a popular attraction where "whispered words" can be heard 140 meters away from the other end of the dam.

If you want to know more, you can check out "Things to Do near Kapunda."
host_about: Tiny Away spearheads the tiny house eco-tourism in Australia. It started because of our desire to offer city dwellers the perfect place to escape from their hectic digital life in the city. Riding on the international trend in tiny houses, we have taken the tiny house movement one step further by partnering with land hosts and placing our beautifully designed and handcrafted tiny homes on wheels in spectacular rural settings. By integrating the concept of tiny houses with eco-tourism, we want to allow everyone a chance to experience the tiny house lifestyle - To Discover Nature and Stay in Comfort.

name: Situated in the beautiful Barossa Valley
description:
The Barossa is one of the worlds greatest producers of wine, boasting 150 wineries & 80 cellar doors. Home to the worlds oldest continuously producing vines. Taste the regions top wines and admire the area from a seat in a helicopter, hot air balloon, dine at some of the best restaurants and explore local villages, visit the big rocking horse, motor museum, chocolate factory, Gorge wild life park and 60min to SA's beaches.
Bring the whole family to this great place with lots of room for fun.
neighborhood_overview:
A peaceful location, within a very short walk to the Lyndoch village. The property is situated at the end of Bevilaqua terrace, opposite the village oval.
Easy walking distance to God's Hill, Kies and Kellermeister winery's, enjoy a relaxing glass of red with a cheese or cooked meat platter, while taking in the stunning views of the countryside. Or wander down to the beautiful historic Lyndoch village for a visit to the local bakery for coffee, or Lord Lyndoch Tavern for something stronger.
There are plenty of walking trails for the more adventurous guests, tennis courts, crickets nets and children's play ground within site of the property.

Lounge room with a reverse cycle air conditioner, DVD player and a 65inch TV.

name: Ferment Suite - Hewitson Guest Suite
description:
FERMENT Guest Suite is part of the original homestead on the property over 160 years old that Dean and Lou Hewitson have lovingly restored. Stay on a working vineyard and winery in the epicentre of Barossa Valley and enjoy unbridled access to all the Valley has to offer.
Take in the unparalleled views over the vineyard while enjoying a glass of Hewitson at the Tasting Room. As a guest you have the privilege to procure wines from The Hewitson Old & Rare Museum Cellar. Just ask!

The space
‘FERMENT’ Suite is a contemporary space, beautifully furnished for a relaxing and comfortable stay. The Suite opens to a living room with a window bench seat with remote control curtains and a flat screen television. This adjoins a dining area with electric fireplace leading to a kitchenette including the mini-bar fridge and wine fridge stocked with super-premium Hewitson wines, dishwasher, sink with hot and cold water, toaster, toastie sandwich maker, microwave, kettle with
neighborhood_overview:
If FERMENT Suite is not available with your schedule, we have another guest room that you could find on Airbnb (CRUSH & PRESS Room) that might be available for you.
There are great dining options available and all just a few minutes away, which we can highly recommend. Most restaurants accept BYO and please let them know you are our guest. You can purchase wine from your Guest Room and from our Tasting Room; or ask us for our Old & Rare Museum Cellar list and choose something special! let us know in advance. Reds will be left on the mini-bar and whites in the fridge in your room.

Other things

host_about:

I am an interior designer and Roger is a property manager, Airbnb has helped us feel at home traveling and now we want to share this special connection to our guests through hosting Airbnb ourselves. I hope you will like our place as much as we do :)
Looking forward to hosting you!
Emma & Roger

name: The Winemaker's Haus
description:
Live like a local and enjoy this stylish and spacious property, surrounded by vineyards just 2 minutes from Tanunda's main street. Inside you will find a fully equipped kitchen, lounge and dining room with woodburning stove and sunset views. Outside you will find a landscaped garden with a BBQ and veranda, fire pit and more spectacular vineyard view. Beyond the house take a 15-minute stroll into Tanunda and enjoy the Barossa's central hub with several restaurants, bars, pubs and a brewery.

The space
Our home is just right for families, couples or friends and has everything you need for a great stay. Little touches such as local coffee from Barossa Coffee Roasters and eco friendly cleaning & shower products from Zero Co mean all you need to bring is your bags.

Furry friends are welcome too, with a full enclosed garden!

Guest access
The whole house and garden are yours to enjoy. There is also a shed and garage which are off limits
neighborhood_overview: We are located just outside Tanunda, with its wineries, cafes, boutiques and restaurants. From the house it's a 5 minute walk to Turkey Flat winery or Barossa Valley Brewing, or take a 15 minute stroll into Tanunda for a coffee or bite to eat. Alternatively take a 10 minute drive to world famous wineries including Jacobs Creek, Seppeltsfield and Penfolds. Or simply stay at home and enjoy sunset over the vines, and maybe even moonrise over the hills on the right night.
host_about: I'm a restauranteur, chef and winemaker in the Barossa Valley. I moved to the Barossa from the UK to pursue my passion for wine. The Winemaker's Haus was our first home and the place where it all started for me and my wife. I am co-owner of Harvest Kitchen and produce wines under my own label - Haus Wine. With over 20 years of hospitality experience and an enthusiasm for all things food and drink I decided it was time to host my own guest house and help people discover the Barossa and all its wonder!

name: A perfect winery weekend-2BR, fireplace, shops!
description:
Our home offers 2 large bedrooms and a spare guest room, a modern bathroom and a spacious lounge area. The large kitchen has quality SMEG appliances including a fridge, microwave, gas cooktop and oven. Generous cupboard space an island bench and an undercover outdoor dining space create a vibe that will delight home cooks and entertainers alike. You will be perfectly positioned at the start of Tanunda's main town, surrounded by shops, cafes and some of Barossa’s best wineries. See you soon!

The space
★ 700m to Tanunda Foodland
★ 2 min drive to ​​Chateau Tanunda winery
★ Tanunda Cellars bottle shop across the road
★ Large, clean bedrooms with adequate storage and workspaces
★ Hotel quality bed linen, towels and complimentary toiletries are provided.
★ Free WiFi
★ Excellent location to wineries
★ Complimentary Welcome Pack: tea, coffee, milk & sugar
★ Free, street parking

Bedrooms: The property is adequately fitte
neighborhood_overview: The red heart of the Barossa, Tanunda sits in prime position surrounded by the region’s best wineries. Deriving its name from the Aboriginal word for watering hole, you’ll certainly find more than a few good spots to quench your thirst around this historic town. Sample wine straight from the barrel at Chateau Tanunda, go back to (wine) school at Greenock Estates or sip bold reds in a heritage stone barn at Rockford Wines. Wander down leafy streets dotted with heritage buildings, stop for lunch at Vino Lokal, indulge your sweet tooth at Barossa Valley Chocolate Company, dig into dinner at fermentASIAN and top it off with a night cap at Musque Food & Wine. Down the road, discover Seppeltsfield; home to Seppeltsfield Winery, Hentley Farm Restaurant and Seppeltsfield Road Distillers
host_about: Experienced traveller and full time air bnb host. Love giving travel tips, great food, good company and of course - COFFEE

name: Tanunda House - Luxury 5 BR in Barossa Wine Region
description:
Prepare to be wowed as you enter this stunning home and discover your private luxury escape set on an acre of beautiful grounds in the heart of Tanunda. A 5 minute walk to excellent restaurants, cafes and wine bars, Tanunda House, with its 5 King bedrooms, pool, tennis court, wine cellar and theatre room is a perfect setting for a relaxing retreat or to celebrate a special occasion with friends, family or colleagues. It is also an ideal base for exploring the world renowned Barossa wine region.

The space
Immaculately presented, Tanunda House boasts the grandeur of its 1910 heritage in its front rooms with high pressed metal ceilings and the original stained glass entrance, then seamlessly moves into a stunning contemporary space featuring indoor and outdoor living/dining with floor to ceiling glass looking over the beautiful swimming pool and gardens. Everything you need, Tanunda House has on offer:

- Five spacious King Bedrooms three of which can be
neighborhood_overview:
Tanunda House is located in the attractive town of Tanunda which is the heart of the world renowned Barossa wine region. A walk around the neighbourhood will lead you down leafy streets past beautiful sandstone homes, historic cottages and a number of lovely old churches - a testament to the Lutheran settlement of the region. Only 50 metres from Tanunda House is Goat Square - an historic meeting place which is now a lovely green lawn surrounded on all sides by heritage 1840s stone cottages.
Restaurants, cafes and wine bars and a wonderfully eclectic selection of shops and galleries for browsing are a short 5 minute walk away from Tanunda House but if you get in your car you can be out driving past vineyards, wineries and charming villages within minutes.

neighborhood_overview: The Eden Valley is the higher altitude section of the Barossa Region, which produces world class cool climate wines, but it is also a peaceful and less populated area, so it is perfect for just relaxing and unwinding. There are vineyards and a few cellar doors nearby but there are many more 20 minutes away down in the valley itself. Springton is 2 kms away and has a general store and a pub. Nearest supermarkets are 20 mins away.

description:
Pet friendly rural farm stay. Newly renovated & fitted out apartment. Views overlooking tall gums & dam , listen to the kookaburras singing, say hi to our beautiful friendly horses. Walking distance to township filled with some unique shops. Farmers market held each Saturday morning just a mere walk down the driveway.
An easy drive to the beautiful Barossa Valley wine region to taste all the Barossa has to offer.
Close to Mt Crawford forest for those who like to be do some bush walking

The space
Your space is at ground level overlooking our property Modern open plan area, quiet location. Kitchen appointed with microwave, induction hot plate, fridge / freezer , coffee maker. Spacious bathroom / ensuite.
QS bed quality linen.
Flat screen wall mounted smart tv, internet , wifi available. You will have the entire ground floor area to yourself, private courtyard with Baby Q webber for bbq cooking, table and chairs which looks out across our hor
neighborhood_overview:
Walking distance to township where you can find some quirky shops, a fabulous gin distillery called Robbers Dog a must visit.
Rustic Edge home and western wear filled with amazing gifts and clothing and flowers.
As we are the gateway to Barossa Valley wine region it’s a short drive to experience all the valley has to offer.
Into a bit of bush walking ? Mt Crawford forest just down the road some lovely bush trails to explore.
Travel east and you will find the River Murray and Mannum Falls. Another short drive takes you into the heart of Adelaide Hills so much to see there the iconic town Hahndorf.
As you can see we are very central to so much.

At Angaston Mews Apartments you can enjoy modern apartment style living with all amenities, including free WiFi. Recently updated with new carpet and fresh paint, each of our four apartments are perfect for couples, families, group get-togethers or corporate travellers.

Apartments offer a fully equipped kitchen with dishwasher. Other features include lounge/dining, Tv, air-conditioning, two bedrooms, one bathroom with spa bath & shower. Standard bedroom configuration is one king bed, two singles. Kings may be split into singles or singles joined to be one king.

Each apartment has a patio area and laundry facilities are provided. Outdoors there is undercover parking, a barbecue/outdoor entertaining area.

name: Three bedroom Vineyard View Villa @ Blickinstal Retreat
description:
Take in an enormous panoramic view, Blickinstal Barossa Valley Retreat is located on the Rolling Hills, which is just 5-min drive from Tanunda. Our properties are surrounded by vineyard and beautiful natural landscape where you can enjoy the stunning sunsets and brilliant star-filled night sky.

Located in the central of Barossa Valley, it is close to an expansive range of wineries and restaurants. This studio is perfect for couples as a lovely base to explore the Barossa Valley.

The space
This is a self-contained villa in Blickinstal Retreat, which can host 6 guests, The villa features three separate bedrooms with starred-hotel linens, a living room, a well-functioned kitchen, and a laundry. The villa provides a relaxed and intimate space with stunning views over the vineyard.

• Master Suite – Double Bed with Airconditioning
• Bedroom 2 – Queen Bed
• Bedroom 3 – Queen Bed
Living room - with Airconditioning
neighborhood_overview: Blickinstal Retreat is located on the Rolling Hills where an expansive range of wineries and restaurants is located. It is onlya  5-minute drive to Tunanda and some renowned cellar doors.
host_about:
Roger and I love traveling, we fell in love with Australia on our honeymoon and moved to here 10 years ago. I am an interior designer and Roger is a property manager, Airbnb has helped us feel at home traveling and now we want to share this special connection to our guests through hosting Airbnb ourselves. I hope you will like our place as much as we do :)
Looking forward to hosting you!
Emma & Roger

name: Para River Cottage
description:
‘Para River Cottage’

Built in 1920 overlooking the gum studded cliff face of the North Para River, this quaint and cosy cottage has been elegantly restored for your fulfilment.

Embrace the quiet rural feel of native birdsong and scattered sheep across the way, all whilst being within a short stroll of the heart of Tanunda.

It’s a great spot to discover the Barossa Valley and a lovely neighbourhood. I have so many great memories here, and I’m convinced that you will too.

Huge house with something for everyone.

No matter if it’s a family vacation or a friends getaway Turret Ridge is the perfect place.

Guest access
You’ll have access to the whole house and two bedrooms. We have two living areas, a large dining table, full kitchen, kids toy area and heaps of pit door space.

name: B/New Barossa Valley House! Walk 2 Tanunda Main St
description:
Stay at Dwelle Barossa Valley Retreat, located in walking distance to all that Tanunda has to offer - great shops, restaurants, pubs, cafes & wine bars (and just a short drive to world-famous wineries). This lovely, modern house is completely brand new (as of Dec 2022) and located in one of Tanunda's best streets. It's quite minimal at this stage, but if you're happy to be in a beautiful, brand new house in an amazing location, then we look forward to hosting you!

The space
The house features a large open-plan living/dining area and full kitchen, laundry, double driveway and alfresco area with seating.

There is one large bedroom with a comfortable queen bed (with walk-in-robe and ensuite with bathtub).

There is also a sofa bed in the study that is suitable for a child. You are free to use it, if you are happy to bring your own linen for it.

All other linen and towels are provided.

We have reverse-cycle, ducted heating a
neighborhood_overview: The heart of the Barossa, Tanunda sits in prime position surrounded by the region’s best wineries. Sample wine straight from the barrel at Château Tanunda, go back to (wine) school at Greenock Estates or sip bold reds in a heritage stone barn at Rockford Wines. Wander down leafy streets dotted with heritage buildings, stop for lunch at Vino Lokal, or dig into dinner at Harvest Kitchen. Down the road, discover Seppeltsfield; home to Seppeltsfield Winery, Hentley Farm Restaurant and Seppeltsfield Road Distillers.
host_about: Hi, I'm John. I'm enjoying semi-retirement and love playing bowls, golf, and catching up with friends for a nice meal and a glass of wine (from the Barossa of course).

name: Shady acres.
description:
This fully furnished,self-contained, stand alone, two bedrooms plus sofa bed, guest unit is nestled on ten acres. It is private, well off the main road, pet friendly with private backyard.

The main house is 200m away.

Yards for horses are opposite the unit. Dressage arena and 650m track are available.

Close by trail riding, cycling/ walking paths, historical townships (Gawler, Two Wells).

Barossa Valley is 25km away.

Come enjoy peace and quiet, whilst being close to amenities.

The space
This fully furnished, self- contained, stand alone, two bedrooms plus sofa bed, guest unit is nestled amongst the trees on ten acres. It is private and well off the main road. The main house is 200mts away. The unit is pet friendly (max 2 dogs). It has it's own fully fenced backyard, complete with BBQ and pergola.

There is ample parking, more than enough for horse floats.

Pets and horses are wel

name: Petit Manor
description:
Petit Manor is located on the fringe of the Barossa Valley on 50 picturesque acres of land with rolling farmland, trees and hills. Perfect for a romantic getaway, the tiny house is set in a scenic location surrounded by alpacas and provides a pleasing blend of modern conveniences in a tranquil setting. It has one bedroom with a queen size bed, a small kitchen and lounge area, it also has a deck and verandah that you can enjoy any time of day. We are approx 1 hour from the city.

The space
We are a working alpaca farm and will often be doing work in the paddocks, we will also be using the tractor, sometimes near the tiny house. This space is not remote, it is close to our house and the other bnb but it is tucked up behind the sheds.

Guest access
Guests can walk around our property but we ask that they do not enter any gates that are closed as we move animals around all the time. They can look around at the gardens, they can also go for a
neighborhood_overview: We are approx 5 mins from Birdwood where you will find a supermarket, pub, bakery, takeaway and other small shops.  We are located approx 1 hour from the city and half an hour to Tanunda, approx 20 mins to Woodside. Sites to see are Gumeracha Rocking Horse, Lavender Farm, Whispering Wall, Hiking trails, nature walks, Warren reservoir where you can hire kayaks, Birdwood Motor Museum and lots of wineries.
host_about: I am a mortgage broker and my husband is a carpenter.  We enjoy renovating houses and are renting this one out for the first time as a bnb.  We own an alpaca farm in Cromer, where you can pat and walk the animals, we currently have approx 15 alpacas on the farm.  We have 3 grown children and 2 dogs.  We also enjoy travelling.

description:
The Fergusson House is situated in Lyndoch, the heart of the Barossa Valley wine district. Perfect for groups to enjoy, or family holidays. A comfortable private house that sleeps 8, making for a memorable Barossa experience that can be used as a base while exploring The Barossa Valley / or a relaxing getaway with a 6-seater therapeutic spa to enjoy. Ample parking including enough space for a caravan or boat. Available for short and long-term stays.

The space
The Fergusson House has 4 bedrooms, 2 living rooms, and 2 large outdoor entertaining areas which includes a 6 -seater therapeutic spa.

The main bedroom is located in its own private wing and has a queen bed, smart tv, an extra living area with a sofa bed, ensuite, and its own access to the outdoor entertaining area. Also has reverse-cycle air conditioning.

The other three bedrooms are off the second wing.
The second bedroom includes a queen bed and a built-in robe.

name: Tanunda Central Cottage
description:
Welcome to our charming cottage in the heart of Tanunda Main Street, Barossa Valley. This recently renovated property has been beautifully restored and offers a comfortable and stylish stay in one of South Australia's most sought-after destinations.

Originally built in 1856, the cottage formed part of the original pharmacy in Tanunda. Today, it is a cozy two-bedroom retreat with all the modern amenities you need for a memorable stay.

The space
The first bedroom features a king and a single bed, while the second bedroom has a comfortable queen bed. In total, the property can sleep up to five guests.

The kitchen is equipped with a cooktop and a microwave convection oven, with cafes, restaurants, and wine bars mere steps from your front door. There is also air conditioning and heating throughout the property to keep you comfortable no matter the season.

Outside, the private courtyard offers a space to relax and unwind. There is outdo

The neighborhood is characterized by quaint, historic buildings and tree-lined streets. It has a population of around 4,000 people and offers a range of amenities, including shops, restaurants, and parks.
